Package com.ibm.security.verifysdk

Class OAuthToken

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.security.verifysdk.OAuthToken
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    @RequiresApi(23)
public class OAuthToken
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Handles the access token and optional refresh token for requests to protected resources.
    Since:
    2.0.0
    Version:
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
    2.1.5

      Constructors

      OAuthToken​(java.lang.String rawJsonData)
      Creates a new OAuthToken object of the given data from Cloud and OnPremise responses.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.String createAuthorizationHeader()
      Returns authorization header from token type and access token.
      java.lang.String getAccessToken()
      Returns the access token issued by the authorization server.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> getAdditionalData()
      Returns the HashMap of additional attributes.
      java.util.Date getCreatedOn()
      Returns the date and time when the token was created.
      java.util.Date getExpiresOn()
      Returns a Date object, representing when the token expires.
      java.lang.String getRefreshToken()
      Returns the refresh token, which can be used to obtain new access tokens using the same authorization grant.
      java.lang.String[] getScope()
      Returns the scope that the token has authorized.
      java.lang.String getTokenType()
      Returns the type of token issued.
      boolean hasTokenExpired()
      Returns whether the token has expired.
      java.lang.String serializeToJson()
      Returns a json formated serialized representation of this instance.
      boolean shouldRefresh()
      The flag to indicate whether the access token should be refreshed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OAuthToken

        public OAuthToken​(@NonNull
                  java.lang.String rawJsonData)
           throws VerifySdkException,
                  java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new OAuthToken object of the given data from Cloud and OnPremise responses.
        Parameters:
        rawJsonData - the body of the server response from the registration endpoint.
        Throws:
        VerifySdkException - if any attributes (except refresh_token) are missing or the argument is not in json format.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any argument is null.

      • hasTokenExpired

        public boolean hasTokenExpired()
        Returns whether the token has expired.
        Returns:
        true if the Date represented by expiresOn was before the current time,

        false otherwise

      • shouldRefresh

        public boolean shouldRefresh()
        The flag to indicate whether the access token should be refreshed.
        Returns:
        • true if 90% of the token lifetime has elapsed since the token created date
        • false otherwise
